issue.message: Field requires API level 24 (current min is 23): `android.app.NotificationManager#IMPORTANCE_DEFAULT`
This view is not constrained vertically: at runtime it will jump to the top unless you add a vertical constraint
This view is not constrained vertically: at runtime it will jump to the top unless you add a vertical constraint
Call requires API level 34 (current min is 23): `openFullScreenIntentSettings`
Call requires API level 33 (current min is 23): `launchChangeAppLanguageIntent`
Attribute `appCategory` is only used in API level 26 and higher (current min is 23)
Attribute `localeConfig` is only used in API level 33 and higher (current min is 23)
Attribute `targetCellWidth` is only used in API level 31 and higher (current min is 23)
Attribute `targetCellHeight` is only used in API level 31 and higher (current min is 23)
Attribute `targetCellWidth` is only used in API level 31 and higher (current min is 23)
Attribute `targetCellHeight` is only used in API level 31 and higher (current min is 23)
Use this.requireActivity() instead of this.activity!!
The application should not provide its own launch screen

Expecting `android:screenOrientation="unspecified"` or `"fullSensor"` for this activity so the user can use the application in any orientation and provide a great experience on Chrome OS devices
Expecting `android:screenOrientation="unspecified"` or `"fullSensor"` for this activity so the user can use the application in any orientation and provide a great experience on Chrome OS devices
Should not restrict activity to fixed orientation. This may not be suitable for different form factors, causing the app to be letterboxed.
Should not restrict activity to fixed orientation. This may not be suitable for different form factors, causing the app to be letterboxed.

For locale "sk" (Slovak) the following quantity should also be defined: `many` (e.g. "10.0 dňa")

Calling this method indicates use of dynamic shortcuts, but there are no calls to methods that track shortcut usage, such as `pushDynamicShortcut` or `reportShortcutUsed`. Calling these methods is recommended, as they track shortcut usage and allow launchers to adjust which shortcuts appear based on activation history. Please see https://developer.android.com/develop/ui/views/launch/shortcuts/managing-shortcuts#track-usage
